claim: Flublok contains 3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.
explanation: Multiple ELISA titer plots comparing geometric mean titers (GMTs) of HA head and stalk–binding antibodies for H3N2, H1pdm09, B/Victoria, and B/Yamagata at day 0 and 1 month post-vaccination across seven vaccine arms (egg-based IIV4, cell-based ccIIV4, and recombinant RIV4 combinations). Error bars indicate 95% confidence intervals; pairwise p values for select comparisons are shown. The figure presents immunogenicity data (ELISA antibody titers) for different vaccine formulations but does not provide any information on the antigen content (e.g., 3× HA dose) of Flublok versus standard-dose vaccines; therefore, it does not support the claim. Note: The figure is clear but is limited to antibody titer comparisons and lacks any data on HA antigen quantities.
